abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Minor
            Irrigation Development Project for Bangladesh were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project suitability was
            likely, Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: good sector work prior to appraisal and
            co-ordination between developments partners can be very
            valuable in assisting governments to embark on correct, but
            politically difficult, sector policy changes. Policy changes
            can have unexpected effects on the viability of investments
            or the implementation mechanisms. At times of rapid policy
            change, supervision missions should be alert to re-examine
            project design assumptions. Promotional activities tend to
            be long term in their effects and benefits are unlikely to
            prove dramatic over a normal project period. Success of
            surface water schemes depends on social/land ownership patterns.
